intro: Cleistocalyx seemannii var. punctatus, commonly known as the spotted hong kong hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its distinctive spotted leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical, with a rough texture and prominent venation. The flowers are usually borne in clusters and bloom during the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
